Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 7th overall pick, by Diablo in 1964...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1965, off Alex Briggs (Mal)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/11/1965, off Ernest Weems (NJ)...
Injured on 4/4/1969 with a Dislocated Finger, out for one week...
Traded from Diablo to Gashouse on 7/21/1970 (Going to GHG: C J. Holm. Going to DIA: C A. Severs, CF J. Brown)...
Injured on 10/8/1971 with a Broken Hand, out for 5-6 weeks...
Was selected to the 1972 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1973 Allstar game...
Won World Championship with Gashouse in 1973...
Was selected to the 1975 Allstar game...
Won World Championship with Gashouse in 1976...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/2/1978, hitting .591 with 3 HR, 7 RBI...
Was selected to the 1978 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/29/1978, hitting .667 with 2 HR, 9 RBI...
Injured on 5/1/1979 with a Dislocated Shoulder, out for 5 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by Northeastern on 2/15/1980 to a 2-year deal worth $5,600,100 per year...
Had 2000th career hit on 9/13/1981, off Max Rameriz (PG)...
Signed as a free agent by Diablo on 2/19/1982 to a 2-year deal worth $3,500,000 per year...
Drove in 6 runs against Boston (UBA) on 6/29/1983...
Signed as a free agent by Halifax on 3/1/1985 to a minor league contract.
Released by Halifax on 4/7/1985...
